result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D. Meshke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Domestic abuse surcharge imposed. Cash bond applied.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug assessment from a licensed agency as determined by Probation Agent and follow any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Elements

Defendant Matthew D. Meshke in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.  
Warren Dwayne Zier appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant questioned and advised of rights. 
16CM22 - no contest plea to sole count. 
16CM100 - no contest plea to Count 2. 
State has complied with victim notifications. 
Court accepts pleas entered after further questioning and finds guilty. 
Sentence recommendations by counsel. 
16CM22 - 60 days jail, imposed/stayed, probation 2 years. 
16CM100 - 90 days jail, imposed/stayed, probation 2 years, concurrent. 
16CM100 - Counts 1 & 3 are dismissed and read in. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs including DOMAB 
- apply cash bond 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- AODA assessment and abide by recommendations 
- absolute sobriety
